data.title: Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice: What cast of classic 1995 BBC series did next
data.meta_description: Some cast members have gone on to win BAFTAs and Academy Awards
data.text:
The 1995 adaption of Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice is fondly remembered by fans across the world.

The six-part series first aired on the BBC from 24 September to 29 October 1995, each episode was 55 minutes long.

The series was quickly picked up by American network A&E and aired in the United States in 1996.

Find out how you can get more news from HampshireLive straight to your inbox HERE.

Pride and Prejudice received five BAFTA Television award nominations and was also nominated for several Emmy's in the United States.

Pride and Prejudice is by far Jane Austen's most famous tale.

The author was born in Hampshire and spent most of her life in the county, her home in Chawton, near Alton, is a popular tourist spot and museum.

The 1995 series also featured a Hampshire-born actor.

Colin Firth, who portrayed romantic-lead Mr Darcy, was born in Grayshott in East Hampshire

The Hants actor has since gone on to star in major Hollywood movies and even win an Oscar.

But what have the rest of the cast done in the last 26 years?

Below, HampshireLive have listed a few key cast members and their achievements since Pride and Prejudice first came out?

Colin Firth

Colin Firth played main heartthrob Mr Darcy, and it is the role that made him a household name in Britain.

He would later go on to play another Darcy in the adaption of Bridget Jones's Diary in 2001, and in the two following films in the series.

The British actor also stared in other romantic comedies such as Love Actually and Shakespeare in Love.

In 2008, he starred in his first musical - the film adaption of Mama Mia! as Harry Bright. He stared alongside Meryl Streep and Amanda Seyfried. He reprised the same role in 2018 in Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again.

Colin's acting talents have been recognised by BAFTA and the Academy Awards.

In 2011, the actor was awarded a Golden Globe, a BAFTA, an Academy Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Award for his role as King George VI in The Kings Speech.

Jennifer Ehle

Jennifer Ehle is a British-American actresswas awarded a BAFTA TV award for her portrayal of Elizabeth Bennet in the 1995 TV series.

Jennifer has an extensive career on screen and in theatre, shortly after staring in Pride an Prejudice she joined the Royal Shakespeare company

In 2000, the actress made her Broadway debut in The Real Thing and won a Tony Award for her performance as Annie.

After a few more stints on the West End and Broadway, it was announced in 2009 that she would play Catelyn Stark in the pilot of HBO's Game of Thrones.

However, Jennifer turned down the role as she felt it was too soon to return to work after the birth of her daughter and instead Michelle Fairley took on the role.

The actress has had roles in films such as The King's Speech, Fifty Shades of Grey series, and The Fundamentals of Caring

Julia Sawalha

Julia Sawalha played Lydia Bennet in the 1995 television series.

From 1992 until 2012, she played Saffron Monsoon in the BBC sitcom Absolutely Fabulous alongside Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley.

Younger viewers may recognise her voice as she voiced Ginger in Chicken Run. In the stop-motion animation, Ginger was the hen determined to save her fellow chickens from death and was seen as the most intelligent chicken in the coop.

In 2001 she became Alan Davies sidekick in Jonathan Creek and starred in the show until 2004 before taking a break from acting.

Returning from her break, she starred in Cranford, Lark Rise to Candleford, and Midsomer Murders

Alison Steadman

Alison Steadman has had an illustrious career in both film and TV.

After portraying mother Mrs Bennet in 1995, the actress has acquired over 50 film and television credits.

She is mainly known for her role in BBC comedy Gavin and Stacey.

The actress appeared in all three series and all the specials as Gavin's mother, Pamela Shipman, alongside Larry Lamb.

Alison has also starred in Orphan Black, The Syndicate, and Love and Marriage.

Susannah Harker

The British actress is best known for her work as Jane Bennet in the TV series of Pride and Prejudice.

Since staring in the series, Susannah has guest starred in many television programmes.

The actress has appeared in Midsomer Murders, Young James Herriot, and New Tricks.

In 2020, Susannah read a poem Jane Austen had sent to her brother about her family home for Jane Austen's House. The museum posted the video to their Facebook page.

Polly Maberly

Polly Maberly played the role of Kitty Bennet - he fourth daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bennet - in the 1995 series.

Since appearing in the programme in 1995, the actress has guest starred in many British favourites.

She has credits in Holby City, Midsomer Murders, and EastEnders.

Lucy Briers

The third sister, Mary Bennet, was portrayed by Lucy Briers in 1995.

Since staring in the programme, she has appeared on stage and on screen in many productions.

On television, viewers may recognise her in BBC comedy Twenty Twelve, Father Brown and Silent Witness.

In 2020, the actress played Mrs Reynolds in the film adaption of Jane Austen's Emma.
